verses.roman:
jambhaṁ śrutvā hataṁ tasya
jñātayo nāradād ṛṣeḥ
namuciś ca balaḥ pākas
tatrāpetus tvarānvitāḥ

synonyms: jambham—Jambhāsura; śrutvā—after hearing; hatam—had been killed; tasya—his; jñātayaḥ—friends and relatives; nāradāt—from the source Nārada; ṛṣeḥ—from the great saint; namuciḥ—the demon Namuci; ca—also; balaḥ—the demon Bala; pākaḥ—the demon Pāka; tatra—there; āpetuḥ—immediately arrived; tvarā-anvitāḥ—with great haste.
translation: When Nārada Ṛṣi informed Jambhāsura's friends and relatives that Jambhāsura had been killed, the three demons named Namuci, Bala and Pāka arrived on the battlefield in great haste.
